meanings.definition: To create a plan or map of (land)
meanings.sent1: The surveyor platted the new neighborhood to show where each house would be built.
meanings.sent2: The city council platted the land to determine the best locations for parks and roads.
meanings.sent3: The architect platted the land in such a detailed way that it looked like a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She platted the garden in her mind, envisioning the perfect layout for her flowers and vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The explorer platted the uncharted territory, marking each landmark with precision.

meanings.definition: To divide (land) into lots for sale
meanings.sent1: The real estate developer platted the large parcel of land into smaller lots for new homes.
meanings.sent2: The farmer platted his fields to sell off sections for future development.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully platted the backyard into imaginary kingdoms for their make-believe game.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur platted the business district, creating zones for different types of shops.
meanings.sent5: The artist platted the canvas, dividing it into sections for each color of the rainbow.
